wikipedia_page.main: James Gourlay (30 October 1862 – 8 June 1926) was a Scottish footballer who played as an outside left.

link_mentions.page: List of Scotland international footballers (1–4 caps)
response: |align=left|The Scottish FA profile merges the statistics of James Gourlay (born 1860) and James Gourlay (born 1862) into a single profile.
James Gourlay is a British conductor.
*James Gourlay (footballer, born 1860) (1860–1939), Scottish international footballer in 1888, father of Jimmy Gourlay
*James Gourlay (footballer, born 1862) (1862–1926), Scottish international footballer in 1886
|Charles Heggie (4), John Lambie, Michael Dunbar, James Gourlay

Born in Annbank, Gourlay played club football for Cambuslang (playing for them in the 1888 Scottish Cup Final alongside his cousin Hugh, who scored their side's goal)Scottish Cup Final Tie Renton V. Cambuslang, The Glasgow Herald, 6 February 1888Renton v Cambuslang 6-1, Scottish Football Association and Annbank, and made one appearance for Scotland against Wales in 1888.(Scotland player) James Gourlay, London Hearts Supporters Club He is often confused with another James Gourlay, also a Cambuslang player, who was capped for Scotland in 1886.
